messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:44): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, bugzilla sucks?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:51): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: bugzilla disrupts Hixie from working on URL stuff
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:55): it does?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:55): maybe someone should file a bug on URL stuff then
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:56): http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/html-wg/20080618#l-109
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:56): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: bugzilla password renewal email sucks
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:57): ah, missed that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:57): i was thinking about filing a bug on <keygen> the other day
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:57): so that I don't forget
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:57): oops. my mail filters suck
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:59): is a bit nervous that that the new block elements are defined to have interaction with implicit </p>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:59): without a parse error
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:00): so authors can now shoot themselves in the foot with omitted </p> during the transition to HTML5
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: issue warnings?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:02): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, why is it a problem?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:02): it breakz teh Webz
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:03): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: in fact, I have a request on file to provide warnigns on implied tags
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:05): Result: Valid HTML5
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:05): Note: implied tags found (learn more, show me)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:05): I fail to see how generating an implied end tag for p when encounting a new element like section will cause back compat problems.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:06): although it will create slightly different DOMs in new browsers compared with current browsers
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:06): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: different DOMs are scary
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:06): might be a mess with styling
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:08): so JS libraries could be used to fix up the DOMs. Just find all section, aside, article, etc., check if any have a P element has a parent and move it.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:08): or just ensure you always use </p> before such an element.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:09): <p> ... <section> ... <h1> ends up with <h1> as sibling of <p>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:09): the real solution is probably adding support for these elements quickly
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:09): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: well that's my point. if you want to ensure it, a validator doesn't tell you
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:10): because you do want the implied <p>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:10): euh, implied </p>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:10): having it for <div> and not for <section> would be weird
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:10): oh, I agree that not having it would be weird in the long run
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:15): fun! the algorithms for li, dd and dt have changed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:26): aargh. AAA step #8 has changed. is it merely editorial?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:27): Changed since when?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:27): I believe there was one non-editorial change since I last looked at it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:27): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: since March 13th
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:29): since May 13th, too
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:32): http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/WD-html5-20080610/diff/tree-construction.html#adoptionAgency
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:34): hey, does anyone have any suggestions for example use cases of data-* attributes, that could be used in an article?

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (17:35): The use cases in this article are already covered by the WF2 attributes with the same name http://www.alistapart.com/articles/scripttriggers/ - so that didn't help me much.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:35): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: it seems to me that the first para of step 8 has changed since the W3C diff
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:38): I'm looking at the diff the wrong way round
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:59): I'm not sure if the not filing bugs in Bugzilla practice works btw. Seems that Hixie files bugs himself to keep himself from doing URL work! Madness
